content.description: Variance climbs the left arete on the steep face of The Outlier Boulder. Because it actually has holds, albeit small ones, Variance doesn't climb like many of the aretes in the area. Start with a left hand sidepull and stand up on a pretty good left foot. Work your way up the arete by using small crimpers for your hands and hard foot movements. The difficulty eases when you get both feet on the less-steep face.

Standard Deviation climbs the right arete on the steep face of The Outlier Boulder. Start low on the arete and throw a right heel up. Work across the arete using both heel and toe hooks and holds with varying degrees of slopy-ness. Eventually top out up and left as per Variance. 

  Climbing this kind of reminded me of the Tin Arete in Pawtuckaway

The Outlier Boulder is the biggest in the area and it's large pyramid shape should be recognizable from far away. Unfortunately, most of the faces are pretty slabby, but the steep face holds two good problems.
